intro: Rhodanthe maculata, commonly known as the spotted pincushion, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy, pink or red flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rhodanthe maculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
